ai-ps3.8:1.2_0: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-ps3.8:1.4_0: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-ps3.8:1.5_0: Meditate observing an aspect of feelings ...
ai-ps3.8:1.6_0: They meditate observing an aspect of the mind ...
ai-ps3.8:1.7_0: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
ai-ps3.8:1.8_0: These are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
ai-ps3.8:2.1_0: And how does one meditate observing an aspect of the body?
ai-ps3.8:2.2_0: It’s when someone is impermanent, not without perception or feeling.
ai-ps3.8:2.4_0: not-self, he will not live without self,
ai-ps3.8:2.7_0: you get rid of the cessation, not to give up.
ai-ps3.8:2.8_0: Seeing impermanence, the perception of impermanence, the perception of not-self in suffering, the perception of not-self in self. They give up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-ps3.8:2.9_0: With these seven ways he will conquer the body
ai-ps3.8:2.10_0: The body is the establishment , but it is not the mindfulness.
ai-ps3.8:2.11_0: Mindfulness is both the establishment and the mindfulness.
ai-ps3.8:2.12_0: By means of that mindfulness and that knowledge he contemplates that body.
ai-ps3.8:3.1_0: development of the four kinds of development:
ai-ps3.8:3.2_0: Herein, observes the five faculties: Then there is a single Factor of development in the sense faculties, and a single Factors of developing the mind and keeping it connected.
